Cemiplimab blocks the programmed death-1 (PD-1) receptor on immune cells, while Ziv-Aflibercept inhibits the formation of new blood vessels in tumors. This combination may help prevent immune evasion by tumor cells and reduce their growth rate, leading to better tumor control and potential disease control in these patients.

In the digital impression group, we'll perform digital imaging procedures using a computerized tomography (CT) scanner to obtain the images of the alveolus, implants, and adjacent bone structures. The software will create a virtual model, and a digital wax-up will be done to mimic the shape design of the denture. The virtual model will then be used to fabricate the denture. 2. Digital impression group: Attachments will be screwed to the implants intraorally, and their position will be scanned using an intraoral scanner. The scanned data will be used to create a virtual model of the dental implant and attachments. Finally, a 3D printed master cast will be obtained using a 3D printer.

Absolutely! Let's go through the reasoning for each study arm:

1. Experimental: QL1706H Part 1 (Dose escalation): This arm is designed to determine the tolerability, dose-limiting toxicity, safety characteristics, optimal dose, immunogenicity, and pharmacokinetics of QL1706H. The sequential cohorts allow for dose escalation until the projected cohorts have been completed, ensuring that the maximum safe dose is identified.

2. Experimental: QL1706H Part 2 (Dose Exploration): This arm is designed to further evaluate the safety, immunogenicity, and pharmacokinetics of QL1706H at different administration intervals. By testing different dosing intervals, the researchers can determine the most effective and efficient dosing regimen for future studies and potential clinical use.

The second study arm, Experimental: QL1706H Part 2 (Dose Exploration), is designed to further evaluate the safety and pharmacokinetics of QL1706H. By exploring different doses and administration intervals, this arm aims to optimize the dosing regimen for clinical use.
